text: Bottle in San Diego. A bit hazy dark golden with a medium head. Aroma of grass, some bread and citrus. Similar taste. The body was medium as was the bitterness.
poured a cloudy golden color with a small white head. Aroma citrus, floral, grass, orange. Flavor, tart orange, some sweet malt,herbs.
Bottle at home way unnecessary this time of night. Dusty gold pour. Nose is fruity esters. Tastes of some herbs, yeast, florals, dried mango. Some alcohol present. Ok
Bomber. Very slightly hazy golden pour with a white head. Grapefruit and pine aroma. Sharp hoppy taste. Sweet citrus and a clean finish.

UPDATED: NOV 5, 2016 Aromas of sweet and sticky orange juice, pine needles and lemon rind too; as well as cereal grains. Tastes of mandarin oranges, lemon zest, pine needles, cereal malts, and sweet bread.

Pours a clear darker golden color with white head. Grass, hay, floral notes, and some light bread on the nose; follows onto the palate. Medium bodied. Finishes with plenty of malty flavors, bread, hay, cereal, and just a slight lingering pine note sneaks in.
Bottle. Pours golden with a medium white head. Aroma of citrus, orange peel, light fruit and grass. Flavor of bready malts, caramel, citrus, orange, earth and grapefruit.

22 ounce bottle. Medium gold color topped by a large Rocky white head. Clinging lace. Subtle floral hop aroma. Bittersweet toasted malt flavor upfront with herbal hop notes. Reminiscent of brewed tea and white pepper. Bullwinkle should have run for President. He is certainly a better option than The Donald or Hillary. Beware of Darkness.
On tap at The Hay Merchant. Pours a hazy gold with medium frothy white head leaving sticky lacing. The aroma is citrus and grass. Medium body, grapefruit, grass, light pine, bitter, good.
On draught. Pours a pale clear yellow with a small white head. Nose is citrus and funk. Taste is subdued pale ale with a nice funk note on the short finish.
Bottle for VP Debate - Pours gold white head - nose/taste of white sugared dusted orange peel, citrus, caramel malt and bready malt - medium body. I miss Weld!!!

Bottle. Pours a peach-colored set. The aroma is a bit like Moms old canned fruit salads. This drink with a bit of a musty funk, with a tart wavetop thats almost mandarin orangey. I love the label, and I guess this is outside the mainstream, too. (#6348, 10/3/2016)

Bottle. Clear dark gold color with lasting ivory head. Dank, earthy, mild sulfur, pit fruit, herbal aromas. Smooth medium body. Nice toasty, cracker, berry fruit, earthy sulfur, citrusy herbal flavors---tangy fruity finish____ good
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: Nice n crisp, herbal and fruity hops, with a sweet malt backbone. Bittersweet finish. Solid.

22oz bottle 9/14/16 (Binnys-Plainfield)-46° in Lager Glass-Pours a clear golden with a small white head. Aroma of hops, malt, hay, and grass. Taste of sweet malt, caramel, citrus, hops, and dough. This medium to full bodied brew is well balanced and pretty darn tasty.
22oz bottle pours a dark orange with some cloudy, white head. Nose has heavy perfume and orange peel, candy. Flavor is white grape, candy, mild pith, some soap. Full bodied finish. Drinks like 10+%.

From the 650 ml. bottle. Light amber pour with a long lasting white head. Looks like the style suggests it should. Lacing. The aroma is a fascinating mix of grainy malts, tobacco, and herbal notes. Also maybe some butterscotch, which is jot always a good thing. The body is smooth and around medium. The taste has this same tobacco and spent malt character with a mild earthy hop finish. No booze.
Hazy golden color; Medium creamy body; Aroma of malt, some yeast, hay, floral hops, & some fruit/citrus; Flavor of sweet malt, caramel, yeast, floral hops, some grain, and fruit/citrus; Decent.

Bottle from Cap Tap. Pours golden with a thick white head and a faint floral aroma. There is a hearty pils flavor with a very dry bitter finish. Lots of flavor for a pils. This beer seems a bit underrated.
22 ounce bottle .. . gold, medium head .. . hay, wood dirt, grass, dried grass .. mouth is easy, mild bitterness .. its okay, but even the 7% comes out quite a bit .. .  nice try, escaping dog
650ml bottle from Binnys in Highland Park. For the tick .... This is a lager. Bready malts. Some light fruit. Some esters. Shrug? Hard to beef this up. 12.4

Draft at WOB Baltimore. Pours almost clear gold with a creamy, fizzy off white head. Tastes like grapefruit hops, resin, bready malt, grassy. Light body and low carbonation. Smells like doughy malt, resin, grapefruit hops, and grass.

Mild hay nose. Shimmering amber, thin head. Hay, malt, neutral. Medium body, soft carbonation, alcohol quite evident. Rather like a maibock with better attenuation. I guess thats what imperial lager is all about.

This is a decent, dry, bitter lager with a finish that combines a hoppy twist and a sweet malt. Pours clear, bright yellow with average head. The aroma is mild, but slightly sweet and fruity, a bit like a white wine. The flavor is like a lager up front, but closes dry and bitter. The slightly rich, sweet malt pervades.

Tap at Capitol Beer in Sacramento, CA. Pours gold with a white head. Aroma suggests white berry fruit. Med body or better. Flavor is moderately bitter, bready malt in the background, white berry and pale stone fruits. A tad spicy - Saaz likely. Its really good.

Pours clear, bubbly golden with a thick and rather persistent porcelain head. Aroma offers weak but tempting fruity, malty and yeasty tones. Flavor delivers yeasty, resiny hop, and crisp fruity tones riding fresh malt for a tasty and slightly bitter pils, rather different from others I have tried in this category. Mouthfeel features decent body, good fizz, and a hoppy and malty finish. A third party candidate? Its a temptation in this election - I cant stand either major party candidate. Whoa, this is a beer rating site, not a political discussion board, so I better quit my rant now.

Love their labels. Not as an aggressive offering as some of their other beers. Pours a tinted yellowish gold, medium white head. Bready sweet, soapy, estery aroma, some booze. Medium bodied... Boozier as it warmed with honey, orange peel and sweet resiness along the way.
Clear gold pour, tight white head. Nose is hay and melons . Leans bitter. Middle is malt, alcohol, cantaloupe. Finish is more of the same.
Draft at Craft. Hazy straw pour with off-white head. Nose was hoppy, pale malt, yeasty fruit. More esters in the flavor, assertive hops, pale malt, honey; an assertive lager.

Drank from a glass, poured from a bomber bottle, 
this beer was a clear orange-gold in the glass with some yellow hues, and gave a one to two finger, creamy, white cover that receded to a half finger of bubbles, it left nice spots and fingers of lacing on the glass that slowly rolled off

the aromas where floral, herb and citrus fruit (faint peach & melon) hops, the hops had a touch of earth to them, light malt and bread notes, 
some bread and sugar sweetness, 

it had flavors of spice and grapefruit citrus hops, light malt and bread flavor with a bread sweetness, 
the hops gave a spice bitterness that hung around on the tongue a bit, 

the mouth feel was about medium, it was creamy and had soft to average carbonation, 

the nose had nice hops with light malt and bread, 
flavor was pretty much the same, the alcohol was hidden in this drink.
Bottle shared by Chalumeaux. Thanks,TJ! 06/16/16. Pours yellow gold with an off white head. Aroma is grass, citrus funk. Flavor is caramel, honey, citrus, grass. Not bad.

Bottled on 6/13/16, drunk 7/23/16.Quickly receding white head tops a clear, apricot-golden body.Tea, oranges, herbs, white pepper, celery, cumin and such...idaho 7 is a weird one. Hmmm, ya thats about all I get. Maybe some dough? No alcohol at least.Better flavor, with flowers (honeysuckle) and lemon-ruby red grapefruit. Orange tea, black pepper and good honey maltiness. Soft, rather sweet and with low but fairly engaging carbonation. Clean with none of the celery-cumin from the nose. No alcohol either. Fine.

Bottl, thanks T.J. Clear yellow, thin head. Aroma is tea leaves, Pilsner malt, light notes of odd fruity note. The body is light with correct carbonation level. The flavor shows a very bad fruit righ in the center. The hop blend doesnt help with strange artificial fruit hint.... Yep, not easy to drink at all.
Poured from bottle dated 6/13/16 clear golden color with a white head. Aromas of peach pear grass tea pine and pepper. Taste is floral citrus notes spice and lingering bitter hops. Interesting.

A burnt orange appearance. no head except a thin white line. The aroma is pretty light, some corn, wheat, honey and melon. Good density with thick carbonation bubbles. piney, rich in flavor, boozy with a ton of bitterness. floral finish with pine needles.
Pretty heavy for a pale lager. Decent beer nonetheless. Which is a stupid word.

22 ounce bottle into tulip glass, bottled on 6/10/2016. Pours slightly hazy golden amber color with a 2 finger dense and rocky off white head with good retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings around the glass. Aromas of peach, apricot, pear, white grape, grapefruit, lemon zest, orange peel, light pepper/pine, cracker, bread, herbal, and floral/grassy earthiness. Very nice aromas with good balance and complexity of citrus/fruity/earthy hops and moderate pale malt notes; with good strength. Taste of peach, apricot, pear, white grape, grapefruit, lemon zest, orange peel, pepper, pine, cracker, bread, herbal, and floral/grassy earthiness. Moderate pine/citrus peel and herbal/spicy bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of peach, apricot, pear, white grape, grapefruit, lemon/orange peel, pepper, pine, cracker, bread, and herbal/floral/grassy earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Very nice complexity, robustness, and balance of citrus/fruity/earthy hops and moderate pale malt flavors; with a great malt/bitterness balance, and zero astringent hop flavors after the finish. Moderate dryness from bitterness as well. Very clean on lager flavors with zero yeast notes present. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth, moderately sticky/resinous, and fairly grainy/bready balanced mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is very well hidden with minimal warming present after the finish. Overall this is a very nice imperial Pilsner style. All around nice complexity, robustness, and balance of citrus/fruity/earthy hops and moderate pale malt flavors; very smooth and easy to drink. A very enjoyable offering.
Poured an amber gold from bomber. Some happy resin aroma. White head. Citrus and some malt. Pretty good

Pours clear gold into a shaker. Bright white head with excellent retention recedes to coat surface. Hay and bread aromas. Thick with hot caramel and sourdough upfront turning to hot bitter earth in the lasting finish. I would have guessed the abv to be higher...
Aroma is very dank hops and light fruit/citrus. The flavor is slightly sweet tropical fruit, grapefruit, hops/very slight hop resin, malts and a bitter/slightly sour/tart finish.
